titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Papers of William H. Kennon, 1808-1903
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Manuscripts Department
The Special Collections Department 38-95
titlepage.publisher: Special Collections Department, University of Virginia Library

defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Web version of the finding aid funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
Papers of William H. Kennon
1808-1903
did.physdesc: This collection consists of ca. 950 items.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of William H. Kennon, Accession #38-95, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was deposited in 1932 by the Rev. William Henry Laird who was acting for Mr. Charles R. Kennon. The collection was made a gift to the Library in December 1980, by Charles R. Kennon, JR., and Richard R. Kennon of Powhatan, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The Kennon family papers, 1808-1903, consist of ca. 950 items which are personal and business papers of William Henry Kennon and his son William Upshur Kennon of "Norwood", Powhatan Co., Va. There is correspondence with prominent Virginians; plantation account books and time books for laborers at "Norwood"; general merchandise accounts of W. S. Corcoran; bank books of members of the Kennon, Heth and Randolph families; and a catalog of the private library at "Norwood" in 1868.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The papers have been arranged chronologically within four boxes and the fifteen volumes have been shelved in the ledger stacks.
